text: [Music]
I'm Bradley Heilmann I'm the CEO of
explorers and a co-founder explorers is
a social classroom platform it's a
teacher guided platform that helps stage
the learning experience and we get all
students involved using social media
skills so for example we'll have
students post about 17 responses each
per 45-minute class and then we use that
information to build data and analytics
on how the kids are doing but also to
give the teacher real-time insight while
they're teaching as to how it's going
our mission is to help campuses and
districts improve instruction by helping
teachers be more effective and efficient
and understand how their students are
doing so that they can personalize the
learning we're using AWS in a few
different ways we're hosting on AWS
we're also working on some data
interoperability aspects that are now
coming into play which we're really
excited about and we've begun machine
learning we've gathered about 40 million
student responses through the platform
and we're using that to inform teachers
as to what to expect when they're
teaching so they can see ahead of time
what kinds of misconceptions students
may have and how to be able to better
teach and just provide teachers more
confidence in light of today's work
we're looking at sage maker and and some
of the comprehend functionality it's
been very good to network with other
folks and we've had very good
conversations both on the architecture
front on the philosophical front when it
comes to the data interoperability
and so I think just in general it's good
to be part of a community
[Music]
